title: The World According to Bertie
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Pat's father, a psychiatrist, found the location very convenient. In the mornings, he could walk from his front door to the front gate of the Royal Edinburgh Hospital within fifteen minutes, and if he was consulting privately in Moray Place he could walk there in twenty-five minutes. The walk to Moray Place was something of a paysage moralisé – easier on the way down than on the way back, when the cares of patients would have been deposited on his shoulders, making Frederick Street and the Mound seem so much steeper and Queen Street so much longer.

title: The Importance of Being Seven
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: In the case of the Edinburgh variant, this principally occurs  amongst visitors who see rather too many Fringe shows in rapid  succession, followed by a visit to your renowned military tattoo. It  is at that point, later in the evening, when the massed pipe bands  march onto the Castle Esplanade that those who are at risk develop  Edinburgh Syndrome and have to be removed to the Royal Edinburgh  Hospital."

title: The Lost Art of Gratitude
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She began to read the text below. A young woman, it reported, had been attacked the previous night near the Royal Edinburgh Hospital; she had fought with her assailant and he had run off. He was a slight man, she said, but that was all the description she managed.
